references.paper_title: Mastering Atari with discrete world models
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of world models in reinforcement learning and directly inspired the current work.

references.paper_title: Elucidating the design space of diffusion-based generative models
references.reason: This paper provides the core diffusion model architecture used in DIAMOND.
This paper is a direct competitor to the current work and established the previous state-of-the-art on the Atari 100k benchmark.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling through stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical foundation for score-based diffusion models and the underlying mathematics used in the current work.
This paper introduced the Atari 100k benchmark, which is the primary experimental evaluation used in this work.
